repnme.cdata!:
Albania - School Rehabilitation and
            Capacity Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcome is satisfactory,
            sustainability is likely, and both performances by the Bank,
            and Borrower are rated satisfactory. Nonetheless, lessons
            indicate that project design should be grounded on
            analytical work, relevant to design decisions, and should
            include sectors that may affect implementation of the
            project, i.e., the absence of a substantial review of the
            construction market, capacities, or practices in Albania,
            underestimated several major risk factors, resulting from
            project design omissions. Furthermore, realistic
            expectations of project outputs, and outcomes should take
            into account major political, economic, and social changes
            likely to occur, as well as weak capacities who may
            undermine effective management, or delay implementation.
            Under political instability, labor-intensive supervision
            should be provided, to include video-conferencing, regular
            communications with the project unit and other key players,
            in addition to training for local Bank staff, to be able to
            strengthen local capacities. Once again it is reinforced
            that broad participation by the Government, and
            stakeholders, as well as an intense dialogue with
            international donors, would result in a stronger sense of
            ownership, and better coordination within the sector to
            attain collaborative tools. Finally, procurement capacity
            should be strengthened, for it is critical to ensure the
            quality of civil works.

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - School Rehabilitation and
            Capacity Building Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The School Rehabilitation and Capacity
            Building Project will sustain the delivery of basic
            education services project during Albania's difficult
            economic transition and to build institutional capacity for
            planning, management and quality assurance of education in
            an increasingly decentralized system. The project will: (a)
            accelerate rehabilitation of damaged and dilapidated school
            facilities in Albania's 37 districts; and (b) build
            capacity of key sector institutions on stimulate efficient
            use of fiscal resources and assure quality of learning outcomes.
